page.title: 16Scarthingmoor House Farm
page.content: This property was originally a {coaching inn,}where{Queen Victoria}is said to have once stayed, when it was known as the Black Lion. Remnants of its former use remain, such as the bells for summoning servants, and a weather vane in the shape of a lion. The family now running the farm keep {livestock,}including cattle, sheep, pigs, goats, and especially large numbers of fowl, mostly bred for sale at market. Large incubators have been installed inside the house to hatch the chicks and ducklings. In the typical farmhouse kitchen, there is a large wall clock which has only 58 minutes marked out on its face.
